intro: Stylochaeton heterophyllum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of brightly colored blossoms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value has led to the cultivation of numerous hybrids and cultivars worldwide.
